intro: Atherosperma sempervirens, commonly known as the evergreen tree, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive bark. The plant typically grows as a tall, straight tree with a broad, spreading crown. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are small and white, often clustered in inflorescences. Atherosperma sempervirens is well adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
